p: In the present study, all plant samples showed concentration-dependent DPPH radical scavenging activity. Among the studied plant samples, the highest antioxidant potential was exhibited by M. malabathricum (IC 50value = 6.27 μg/mL), followed by F. glaberrima, and F. esculentum with IC 50 values of 11.7 and 55.98 μg/mL, respectively. The lowest antioxidant activity was exhibited by C. thevetia (IC 50value = 479.77 μg/mL), followed by A. erubescens, A. bidentata, and L. neesiana with IC 50 values of 376.95, 314.56, and 297.89 μg/mL, respectively. The antioxidant potential of standard ascorbic acid was found to be 4.73 μg/mL.
